availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 11; Bundles of AG & QMG Expenditures 1864-65; Bundle 3

body.p:
Copy of C
STATE OF KENTUCKY.
Office of Quarter-Master General,
Frankfort, Ky., , 186.

On account of Parker Snow & Co of Meriden Connecticut, not receiving our contract with until three weeks after it was made oweing to the uncertainty of the mails we agree to extend their time until the month of August, at which time, Parker Snow & Compy agree to make the July and August delivery, and the other guns to be delivered as agreed upon in the original contract between Parker Snow & Compy and the State of Kentucky.
The gun as shown us on the 26th of June is approved.
S G Suddarth Q M G of Ky
